intro: Lupinus micensis, commonly known as the Miceño lupine, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces showy, sparsely branched flower clusters that range in color from blue to purple. Lupinus micensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Its seeds are encased in pods and are an important food source for local wildlife.
